message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a new learning problem to encourage deep networks to have stable derivatives over larger regions, which is a common problem in machine learning and specifically in deep learning. The paper focuses on networks with piecewise linear activation functions, which is a common approach in deep learning. The experiments are conducted on image and sequence datasets, which are common in computer vision and natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel relaxation to scale the algorithm to realistic models, which is related to optimization and numerical analysis, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the paper also mentions recurrent networks, which are commonly used in natural language processing, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) a possible sub-category.
